question.title: Module-info.java in IntelliJ not able to find my module
question.body:
I have an Intellij project where I have 2 modules inside my project (names of those 2 modules are cmdv3 and functional-tests). I'm trying to prevent my internal library classes from being exposed or used by the clients and for that I'm using module-info.java.

All my code is inside the cmdv3 module. Some of the classes in that module need to be accessed by all the clients. But some internal classes (like service layer, repository etc.) need to be hidden and made inaccessible to the users. I have a module-info.java where I specify which packages to export under src/main/java of the cmdv3 module. It is something like

module cmdv3 {
  exports controllers;
  exports config;
  exports definitions;
  ......
}

where controllers, config, definitions etc. are all packages that I want to export and therefore make the classes of those packages accessible.

Now in my functional-tests module, I have another module-info.java file that will use all the classes from the packages exported from cmdv3 module. That file looks like

module functional.tests {
  requires cmdv3;
}

When I try to run all my tests in the functional-tests module (just like how clients would use the code), I get an error from IntelliJ saying that java: module not found: cmdv3

My question is how can this be happening? When I was trying to write the module-info.java file of my functional-tests module, IntelliJ even gave me a suggestion after I typed requires to use the cmdv3 module.

Has anyone run into this issue before where IntelliJ is not able to find the module if you have a module-info.java file? Everything was working fine until I added the module-info.java file to make only classes of certain packages accessible. Is there any other way that I can achieve this functionality without even having this module-info.java file? I cannot use the default access modifier for my classes in cmdv3 module since a lot of those classes are used in other packages of the cmdv3 module.
